source.author: Smith, L.P.
source.title: Geranium
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 4. Cornaceae to Asteraceae
source.citation: From: Smith, L.P. (1999). Geranium. In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 4. Cornaceae to Asteraceae. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Stems and petioles with indumentum of short to long recurved and appressed hairs; seeds with elongate alveolae
Stems and petioles with minute spreading and recurved hairs (almost canescent); seeds with small isodiametric alveolae
Seeds black, rugose with relatively deep alveolae; upper montane to subalpine
Seeds brown, virtually smooth with shallow alveolae; lowland to foothills
